title: How to Make Stuffed Sock Animals

steps.headline: Take a sock, and stuff it full of old fabric scraps, tissues, or stuffing.
Sew the end so it is secure.
Tie a ribbon about to separate the head from the body.
steps.description: You should tie the ribbon so that the head is one fourth the size of the whole body. You may sew the ribbon in place, or leave it so that it can be removed.

steps.headline: Cut two oblong oval shapes out of another sock and sew them/fabric glue them to the side of the sock on it's head.
steps.description: These will be the dog's ears.

steps.headline: Cut facial features out of the black sock so that they can stand out.
steps.description: You can cut out two eyes, a triangular nose, and a mouth. The mouth can be smiling, in a :3 shape, or none at all! You could even use buttons for the eyes!

steps.headline: Give your stuffed dog a name and love him/her forever!
Take a sock and stuff it full of old fabric scraps, tissues, or stuffing.
steps.description: Sew the end so it is secure.

steps.headline: Tie a ribbon about to separate the head from the body.
steps.description: You should tie the ribbon so that the head is one fourth the size of the whole body. You may sew the ribbon in place, or leave it so that it can be removed.

steps.headline: Cut out two triangular shapes out of another sock.
steps.description: Sew/fabric glue them onto the cat's head. This will be it's ears.

steps.headline: Cut facial features out of black sock so that they can stand out.
steps.description: You can cut out two eyes, a triangular nose, and a mouth. The mouth can be smiling, in a :3 shape, or none at all! You could even use buttons for the eyes!

steps.headline: Give your stuffed cat a name and love him/her forever!
Take a sock and stuff it full of old fabric scraps, tissues, or stuffing.
steps.description: Sew the end so it is secure.

steps.headline: Tie a ribbon about to separate the head from the body.
steps.description: You should tie the ribbon so that the head is one fourth the size of the whole body. You may sew the ribbon in place, or leave it so that it can be removed.

steps.headline: Add your animal's ears.
steps.description: Cut them out of fabric scraps. Sew/glue them onto your animal's head.

steps.headline: Add your animal's facial features or details.
steps.description: Cut them out of another sock or fabric scraps. Glue/sew them on your animal.

steps.headline: Give your animal a name and love him/her forever!

text: Making a Sock Dog Find a sock.  Take a sock, and stuff it full of old fabric scraps, tissues, or stuffing.  Sew the end so it is secure.  Tie a ribbon about to separate the head from the body. You should tie the ribbon so that the head is one fourth the size of the whole body. You may sew the ribbon in place, or leave it so that it can be removed. Cut two oblong oval shapes out of another sock and sew them/fabric glue them to the side of the sock on it's head. These will be the dog's ears. Cut facial features out of the black sock so that they can stand out. You can cut out two eyes, a triangular nose, and a mouth. The mouth can be smiling, in a :3 shape, or none at all! You could even use buttons for the eyes! Give your stuffed dog a name and love him/her forever!  Making a Sock Cat Take a sock and stuff it full of old fabric scraps, tissues, or stuffing. Sew the end so it is secure. Tie a ribbon about to separate the head from the body. You should tie the ribbon so that the head is one fourth the size of the whole body. You may sew the ribbon in place, or leave it so that it can be removed. Cut out two triangular shapes out of another sock. Sew/fabric glue them onto the cat's head. This will be it's ears. Cut facial features out of black sock so that they can stand out. You can cut out two eyes, a triangular nose, and a mouth. The mouth can be smiling, in a :3 shape, or none at all! You could even use buttons for the eyes! Give your stuffed cat a name and love him/her forever!  Making Any Animal You Want Take a sock and stuff it full of old fabric scraps, tissues, or stuffing. Sew the end so it is secure. Tie a ribbon about to separate the head from the body. You should tie the ribbon so that the head is one fourth the size of the whole body. You may sew the ribbon in place, or leave it so that it can be removed. Add your animal's ears. Cut them out of fabric scraps. Sew/glue them onto your animal's head. Add your animal's facial features or details. Cut them out of another sock or fabric scraps. Glue/sew them on your animal. Give your animal a name and love him/her forever!
